steps.title: Collect your plant materials when they are at their peak of color.
steps.content: Collect your plant materials when they are at their peak of color. Flowers should be fresh, Berries should be very ripe, not withered.

steps.title: Chop all plant materials into small pieces (inch or smaller) and place them into a large pot or pan that you are willing to sacrifice to the cloth dyeing craft.
steps.content: Chop all plant materials into small pieces (inch or smaller) and place them into a large pot or pan that you are willing to sacrifice to the cloth dyeing craft. You will not be able to use it for cooking again.

steps.title: Measure the amount of plant material and place twice as much water as plant material into the pot with the plant material.
steps.content: Measure the amount of plant material and place twice as much water as plant material into the pot with the plant material. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Bring the mixture to a boil and then simmer it, stirring occasionally, for at least an hour.
steps.content: Bring the mixture to a boil and then simmer it, stirring occasionally, for at least an hour. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Strain out the plant material and set the dye bath aside.
steps.content: Strain out the plant material and set the dye bath aside.

steps.title: Place your fabric into a color fixative bath such as salt water (1 part salt to 16 parts water) or a vinegar bath (1 part vinegar to 4 parts water).
steps.content: Place your fabric into a color fixative bath such as salt water (1 part salt to 16 parts water) or a vinegar bath (1 part vinegar to 4 parts water). [3] X Research source

steps.title: Allow the fabric to absorb the color fixative mix and simmer it for an hour.
steps.content: Allow the fabric to absorb the color fixative mix and simmer it for an hour.

steps.title: Remove the fabric from the fixative and wring it out thoroughly.
steps.content: Remove the fabric from the fixative and wring it out thoroughly.

steps.title: Place the wet fabric into the dye mixture and simmer it until the desired color is achieved.
steps.content: Place the wet fabric into the dye mixture and simmer it until the desired color is achieved. The dry product will be lighter than the wet product, so go for a slightly darker color when wet.

steps.title: Remove the fabric from the dye bath with rubber gloves.
steps.content: Remove the fabric from the dye bath with rubber gloves. (You want to dye the cloth, not your hands.)

steps.title: Wring the fabric thoroughly and hang it up to dry.
steps.content: Wring the fabric thoroughly and hang it up to dry.

steps.title: Launder naturally dyed fabrics in cold water and separate from other laundry.
steps.content: Launder naturally dyed fabrics in cold water and separate from other laundry. [4] X Research source
